tit.e: Sakaya (a term related to sake (rice wine))
Sakaya (a term related to sake (rice wine))
tit.cmt: タイトルのため、括弧内の補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 酒屋（さかや）とは、鎌倉時代に始まった、日本酒を醸造し、販売する業者を指す。
sen.e: Sakaya indicates an operator of the sake-producing/selling business that started in the Kamakura period.
Sakaya indicates an operator of the sake-producing/selling business that started in the Kamakura period.
Sakaya indicates an operator of the sake-producing/selling business that started in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: しだいに多額の資本を持つようになり、土倉（どそう）などの金融業や、荷送りなどの流通業、通信業などさまざまな業種を扱うようになった。
sen.e: Becoming to own lots of capital gradually, sakaya also became to handle businessin n various areas, including financial business, such as doso (a pawnbroker and money lender), distribution business, such as packing and wrapping, and communication business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Coming to own lots of capital gradually, sakaya also came to handle business in various areas, including financial business, such as doso (a pawnbroker and money lender), distribution business, such as packing and wrapping, and communications business.

Coming to own lots of capital gradually, sakaya also came to handle business in various areas, including financial business, such as doso (a pawnbroker and money lender), distribution business, such as packing and wrapping, and communications business.

sen.j: このようにして、京都市中に大きな店舗をかまえ、手代や丁稚などの店員のほか、用心棒なども養う豪商となった。
sen.e: In this way, sakaya became a wealthy merchant who had a big store at the center of Kyoto City and employed bodyguards in addition to store personnel, such as clerks and apprentices.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this way, sakaya became wealthy merchants who had big stores at the center of Kyoto City and employed bodyguards in addition to store personnel, such as clerks and apprentices.
In this way, sakaya became wealthy merchants who had big stores at the center of Kyoto City and employed bodyguards in addition to store personnel, such as clerks and apprentices.

sen.j: 現代でいう総合商社のような要素もあり、また京都以外の町では現代でいう商工会議所の会頭のような顔役としての役割も果たした。
sen.e: Sakaya was also provided with a factor of something like a general trading house in the present day, and in the twons other than Kyoto, the owner of sakaya played the role of a man of influence, like the president of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

Sakaya were also provided with a factor of something like a general trading house in the present day, and in the towns other than Kyoto, the owner of sakaya played the role of a man of influence, like the president of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

Sakaya were also provided with a factor of something like a general trading house in the present day, and in the towns other than Kyoto, the owner of sakaya played the role of a man of influence, like the president of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

sen.j: それに対して、純粋に醸造業と酒の販売だけに専念する零細な酒屋を造り酒屋と呼んで区別する。
sen.e: For this, the small-scaled sakaya that is genuinely specialized in the business of manufacturing and selling sake alone is called tsukuri-zakaya (tsukuri indicates manufacturing) to differentiate it from sakaya.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For this, the small-scaled sakaya that is genuinely specialized in the business of manufacturing and selling sake alone is called tsukuri-zakaya (tsukuri indicates manufacturing) to differentiate it from sakaya.

For this, the small-scaled sakaya that is genuinely specialized in the business of manufacturing and selling sake alone is called tsukuri-zakaya (tsukuri indicates manufacturing) to differentiate it from sakaya.

sen.j: しかしながら、その境界線は明確に定義づけられているわけではない。
sen.e: However, the boundary between sakaya and tsukuri-zakaya is not defined clearly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the boundary between sakaya and tsukuri-zakaya is not defined clearly.
However, the boundary between sakaya and tsukuri-zakaya is not defined clearly.

sen.j: もともとは造り酒屋から始まった酒屋であっても、酒で財を成したとはいえ、原業の醸造業は衰滅してしまい、残った財を資本として他の業種に乗り出していき、さらに成長していった酒屋もある。
sen.e: When a tsukuri-zakaya accumulated wealth through sake business, it could happen that the sakaya started other types of business and became more wealthy, although the original sake business declined.
When a tsukuri-zakaya accumulated wealth through sake business, it could happen that the sakaya started other types of business and became more wealthy, although the original sake business declined.
When a tsukuri-zakaya accumulated wealth through sake business, it could happen that the sakaya started other types of business and became more wealthy, although the original sake business declined.

sen.j: だから「酒を売らない酒屋」というのも存在する。
sen.e: Therefore, "a sakaya not selling sake" exists.
Therefore, "a sakaya not selling sake" exists.
Therefore, 'a sakaya not selling sake' exists.

sen.j: いっぽう、「酒を売らない造り酒屋」というのはまず存在しないと言ってよい。
sen.e: On the other, "a tsukuri-zakaya not selling saky" scarecely exists.
On the other hand, "a tsukuri-zakaya not selling sake" don't really exist.
On the other hand, 'a tsukuri-zakaya not selling sake' don't really exist.

sen.j: 語源
sen.e: The origin of the term of sakaya
The origin of the term sakaya
The origin of the term sakaya

sen.j: もともとは一つの村落で、村人が共同で酒を造る小屋のことを酒屋（さかや）といった。
sen.e: Originally, a hut where villagers manufactured sake jointly was called sakaya (literally, sake house).
Originally, a hut where villagers manufactured sake jointly was called sakaya (literally, sake house).
Originally, a hut where villagers manufactured sake jointly was called sakaya (literally, sake house).

sen.j: そういう建築物としての酒屋は現在でも、合掌造りで知られる飛騨において見ることができる。
sen.e: Such a building for sakaya still exists in Hida, the place famous for Gassho-zukuri (a house built of wooden beams combined to form a steep thatched roof that resembles two hands together).
Such a building for sakaya still exists in Hida, the place famous for Gassho-zukuri (a house built of wooden beams combined to form a steep thatched roof that resembles two hands together).
Such a building for sakaya still exists in Hida, the place famous for Gassho-zukuri (a house built of wooden beams combined to form a steep thatched roof that resembles two hands together).

sen.j: 職業としての「酒屋」への移行に関しては「中世以前」を参照のこと。
sen.e: For how "sakaya" business started, refer to the secition of "In the medieval period or before."
For how the "sakaya" business started, refer to the section of "In the medieval period or before."
For how the 'sakaya' business started, refer to the section of 'In the medieval period or before.'

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 中世以前
sen.e: In the medieval period or before
In the medieval period or before
In the medieval period or before

sen.j: 平安時代以前には、朝廷には造酒司（もしくは造酒寮）が、神社には酒殿が置かれて、民間では自家製造が主であった。
sen.e: In the Heian periord or before it, miki-no-tsukasa or miki-no-tsukasa (either indicating the office in charge of the imperial use of sake, sweet sake, or vinegar etc.) was placed in the imperial court, saka-dono (literally, a sake hall) was placed in shrines, and for private puropses, people manufactured sake by themselves.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Heian periord or before it, miki-no-tsukasa or miki-no-tsukasa (either indicating the office in charge of the imperial use of sake, sweet sake, or vinegar etc.) was placed in the imperial court, saka-dono (literally, a sake hall) was placed in shrines, and for private puropses, people manufactured sake by themselves.

In the Heian period or before it, miki no tsukasa or sake no tsukasa (written either 造酒司 or 造酒寮) (either indicating the office in charge of the imperial use of sake, sweet sake, or vinegar etc.) was placed in the Imperial Court, saka-dono (literally, a sake hall) was placed in shrines, and for private purposes, people manufactured sake by themselves.
sen.cmt: 造酒司（もしくは造酒寮) miki no tsukasa or sake no tsukasa とし、漢字も追加しました。

sen.j: 酒を製造・販売する業者の記録は確認されていない。
sen.e: No record is available about sake-manufacturing/selling business operators.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: No record is available about sake-manufacturing/selling business operators.
No record is available about sake-manufacturing/selling business operators.

sen.j: やがて杜氏の職業的先駆にあたる酒師（さかし）が民間で自分で酒を造り、売るところを酒屋というようになっていった。
sen.e: Then sake brewers called sakashi, who were predecessors of toji (sake brewing experts), became to manufacture and sell sake privately by themselves, and the place where such sake was sold became to be called sakaya.

Then sake brewers called sakashi, who were predecessors of toji (sake brewing experts), came to manufacture and sell sake privately by themselves, and the place where such sake was sold came to be called sakaya.

Then sake brewers called sakashi, who were predecessors of toji (sake brewing experts), came to manufacture and sell sake privately by themselves, and the place where such sake was sold came to be called sakaya.

sen.j: このなかで醸造業を中心とする商店と、金融業を中心とする商店で、のちの「造り酒屋」と「酒屋」が分化していく。
sen.e: Of theses places, the stores specialized in manufacturing sake became to be called "tsukuri-zakaya," and those where weight was placed rather on financilal bussiness was became called "sakaya."
Of theses places, the stores specialized in manufacturing sake came to be called "tsukuri-zakaya," and those where emphasis was placed on financial business became "sakaya."
Of theses places, the stores specialized in manufacturing sake came to be called 'tsukuri-zakaya,' and those where emphasis was placed on financial business became 'sakaya.'

sen.j: 民間の酒屋は鎌倉時代に全国的に発生した。
sen.e: Many privately-operated sakaya appeared throughout the nation in the Kamakura period.
Many privately-operated sakaya appeared throughout the nation in the Kamakura period.
Many privately-operated sakaya appeared throughout the nation in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 当初鎌倉幕府はこうした業者を禁止していたが、京都の朝廷では財源不足を補うために酒屋を認めてその代わりに酒造役（壷銭）を徴収した。
sen.e: Although the kamakura bakufu initially prohibited such operation of business, the imperial court in Kyoto permitted sakaya business but collected sake-related tax called shuzo-yaku (or tsubo-sen) instead, to compensate its finacial shortage,).

Although the kamakura bakufu initially prohibited such operation of business, the imperial court in Kyoto permitted the sakaya business but collected sake-related tax called shuzo-yaku (or tsubo-sen) instead, to compensate for its financial shortage).

Although the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) initially prohibited such operation of business, the Imperial Court in Kyoto permitted the sakaya business but collected sake-related tax called shuzo-yaku (or tsubo-sen) instead, to compensate for its financial shortage.
sen.cmt: 幕府 補足を追加しました。文末の括弧を削除しました。

sen.j: 室町時代には隆盛を極めた。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, many sakaya flourished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, many sakaya flourished.
In the Muromachi period, many sakaya flourished.

sen.j: 応永32年（1425年）には洛中洛外の酒屋の数は342軒に達していたことが記録に残っている。
sen.e: A record shows that there were 352 sakaya inside and outside Kyoto in 1525.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A record shows that there were 352 sakaya inside and outside Kyoto in 1525.
A record shows that there were 342 sakaya inside and outside Kyoto in 1425.

sen.j: 文安の麹騒動（1444年）以後は京都においては麹屋業も吸収合併した。
sen.e: After Bunan no Koji Sodo (a riot caused by rice malt sellers in the Bunan era) in 1444, rice malt-manufacturing business was merged into sakaya even in Kyoto.
After Bunan no Koji Sodo (a riot caused by rice malt sellers in the Bunan era) in 1444, the rice malt-manufacturing business was merged into sakaya even in Kyoto.
After Bunan no Koji Sodo (a riot caused by rice malt sellers in the Bunan era) in 1444, the rice malt-manufacturing business was merged into sakaya even in Kyoto.

sen.j: 室町幕府にとっては、酒屋に貸した酒屋役（さかややく）は、土倉に貸した倉役（くらやく）とならんで、幕府の重要な財源となった。
sen.e: For the Muromachi bakufu, sakayaku, tax levied on sakaya, became an important financial source, together with kurayaku, tax levied on doso.
sen.cmt: 貸した： ”かした”（”（税金として）かけた”）の意味に解釈して訳してあります。
sen.e: For the Muromachi bakufu, sakayaku, tax levied on sakaya, became an important financial source, together with kurayaku, tax levied on doso.
For the Muromachi bakufu, sakaya-yaku, tax levied on sakaya, became an important financial source, together with kura-yaku, tax levied on doso.
sen.cmt: 酒屋役→sakaya-yaku としました。

sen.j: 室町時代中期以後は弱体化した室町幕府や、経済的に貧しくなった朝廷に対しても、酒屋は大きな政治的発言力を持った。
sen.e: After the middle era of the Muromachi period when the pwoer ofthe Muromachi bakufu became weak and the finance of the imperial court became deteriorated, sakaya became to have a big political influence for the bakufu and the imperial court..

After the middle era of the Muromachi period when the power of the Muromachi bakufu became weak and the finance of the imperial court deteriorated, sakaya came to have a big political influence on the bakufu and the imperial court.

After the middle era of the Muromachi period when the power of the Muromachi bakufu became weak and the finance of the Imperial Court deteriorated, sakaya came to have a big political influence on the bakufu and the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 安土桃山時代には、日本各地はもとより東南アジア諸国との南蛮貿易に進出する酒屋もあらわれ、豪商として育っていった。
sen.e: In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, some sakaya advanced into trade with Spain and Portugal through eastern Asian nations as well as various places in Japan, growing into wealty merchants.
In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, some sakaya advanced into trade with Spain and Portugal through eastern Asian nations as well as various places in Japan, growing into wealthy merchants.
In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, some sakaya advanced into trade with Spain and Portugal through eastern Asian nations as well as various places in Japan, growing into wealthy merchants.

sen.j: またこういう富裕層から茶道のような洗練された文化も生まれた。
sen.e: From people in such a wealthy class, refined culture, such as sado (tea ceremony), was born.
From people in such a wealthy class, refined culture, such as sado (tea ceremony), was born.
From people in such a wealthy class, refined culture, such as sado (tea ceremony), was born.

sen.j: 近世
sen.e: In recent times
In recent times
In the early-modern times
sen.cmt: 近世→early-modern times としました。

sen.j: 江戸時代になると、大都市となった江戸を中心として、金融業でも醸造業でもない、他のところで醸造した酒を販売する（今日でいう「酒屋」のイメージに近い）商店として酒屋が多く出現するようになる。
sen.e: Entering the Edo period, many sakaya selling the sake manufactured by others, not doing a financial business operation nor manufacturing sake, (or business close to the image of the "sakaya" in the present day), appeared centered on Edo that became a big city.

Entering the Edo period, many sakaya selling the sake manufactured by others, not doing financial business operation nor manufacturing sake, (or business close to the image of the "sakaya" in the present day), appeared centered on Edo that had become a big city.

Entering the Edo period, many sakaya selling the sake manufactured by others, not doing financial business operation nor manufacturing sake, (or business close to the image of the 'sakaya' in the present day), appeared centered on Edo that had become a big city.

sen.j: 彼らは強固な組合をもち、江戸酒問屋や江戸十組問屋を組織していった。
sen.e: They are associated with each other strongly, and organized a wholesale marchant of sake in Edo and Edo tokumidonya (a guild of wholwsale marchants of ten products in Edo).
They were associated with each other strongly, and organized the wholesale sale of sake in Edo and Edo tokumidonya (a guild of wholesale merchants of ten products in Edo).
They were associated with each other strongly, and organized the wholesale sale of sake in Edo and Edo tokumidonya (a guild of wholesale merchants of ten products in Edo).

sen.j: 酒屋が室町時代のころに持っていた政治的影響力は表面的に減じたが、それでも幕閣、奉行、代官らに多額の政治献金を送り、陰の政治力はかなり残っていたと考えてよい。
sen.e: Although the political power sakaya had in the Muromachi period diminished superficially, it can be considered that they made considerable financial contribution to the cabinet officials of the Shogunate, magistrates and local governors, still retaining a significant political power behind the scenes.

Although the political power sakaya had in the Muromachi period diminished superficially, it can be considered that they made considerable financial contribution to the cabinet officials of the Shogunate, magistrates and local governors, still retaining a significant political power behind the scenes.

Although the political power sakaya had in the Muromachi period diminished superficially, it can be considered that they made considerable financial contribution to the cabinet officials of the Shogunate, magistrates and local governors, still retaining a significant political power behind the scenes.

sen.j: 宝永年間や文化 (元号)年間に見られるように、酒屋たちが連帯して反対すると、幕府も一度出した法度でもあわててひっこめたりしているくらいである。
sen.e: The power was so great that, in the Hoei era (1704 - 1711) and in the Bunka era (1804 - 1818), the bakufu withdrew a law presented for approval, when the sakaya opposed it jointly.
The power was so great that, in the Hoei era (1704 - 1711) and in the Bunka era (1804 - 1818), the bakufu withdrew a law presented for approval, when the sakaya opposed it jointly.
The power was so great that, in the Hoei era (1704 - 1711) and in the Bunka era (1804 - 1818), the bakufu withdrew a law presented for approval, when the sakaya opposed it jointly.

sen.j: 幕府としても酒株運上金の導入（うんじょうきん）、冥加金（みょうがきん）など、何かと口実をつけて酒屋からの献金に財源を期待した。
sen.e: The bakufu expected contribution from sakaya using the names, for example, of business tax on sakekabu (an official certificate of sake brewing) or myogakin (tax for certifying business right).
The bakufu expected contribution from sakaya using the names, for example, of business tax on sakekabu (an official certificate of sake brewing) or myogakin (tax for certifying business right).
The bakufu expected contribution from sakaya using the names, for example, of business tax on sakekabu (an official certificate of sake brewing) or myogakin (tax for certifying business right).

sen.j: 昔ながらの酒屋といえば日本酒の歴史昭和時代中期でも「三河屋」という屋号で知られる。
sen.e: "Mikawaya" has been well known as the name of traditional sakaya even in the Showa and later eras.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処日本酒の歴史昭和時代中期： ウェブを参照し”昭和時代以降”と置き換えて、訳してあります。
sen.e: "Mikawaya" has been well known as the name of traditional sakaya even in the Showa and later eras.
As the name of traditional sakaya, 'Mikawaya' has been well known even in the Showa and later periods.
sen.cmt: eras→ periods としました。"→ ' としました。

sen.j: これは、17世紀末には江戸十組問屋という10の同業者組合ができ、中でも酒、味噌、醤油を扱う「酒店組」には、徳川家康が三河を領していた小大名だったころから松平家に出入りしていた（あるいは、そのように自称する）三河出身者が多くまた繁盛したことによる。
sen.e: This is due to the following reason: Towards the end of the 17th century, ten guilds called Edo tokumidonya, each for a different kind of business, were established, and in particular, many merchants from the Mikawa province, who had supplied goods to the Matsudaira family since the era when Ieyasu Tokugawa was the daimyo of the small Mikawa province (or who said they were such persons), belonged to the "sake store guild," which handled sake, miso (fermented soybean paste) and soy sauce, and were prosperous.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is due to the following reason: Towards the end of the 17th century, ten guilds called Edo tokumidonya, each for a different kind of business, were established, and in particular, many merchants from the Mikawa province, who had supplied goods to the Matsudaira family since the era when Ieyasu Tokugawa was the daimyo of the small Mikawa province (or who said they were such persons), belonged to the "sake store guild," which handled sake, miso (fermented soybean paste) and soy sauce, and were prosperous.

This is due to the following reason: Towards the end of the 17th century, ten guilds called Edo tokumidonya, each for a different kind of business, were established, and in particular, many merchants from the Mikawa Province, who had supplied goods to the Matsudaira family since the era when Ieyasu TOKUGAWA was the daimyo (feudal lord) of the small Mikawa Province (or who said they were such persons), belonged to the 'sake store guild,' which handled sake, miso (fermented soybean paste) and soy sauce, and were prosperous.
sen.cmt: Province 大文字にしました。

sen.j: 暖簾分けの他にも、繁盛にあやかろうと三河屋を名乗るものが多くなった。
sen.e: Use of the name of Mikawaya increased because a store separated from an original Mikawaya also used the name of Mikawaya and also because many independently established stores used the Name of Mikawaya to share the luck of Mikawaya's prosperity.

Use of the name of Mikawaya increased because a store separated from an original Mikawaya also used the name of Mikawaya and also because many independently established stores used the name of Mikawaya to share the luck of Mikawaya's prosperity.

Use of the name of Mikawaya increased because a store separated from an original Mikawaya also used the name of Mikawaya and also because many independently established stores used the name of Mikawaya to share the luck of Mikawaya's prosperity.

sen.j: 酒屋万流
sen.e: Sakaya banryu (literally, many flows of sakaya)
Sakaya banryu (literally, many flows of sakaya)
Sakaya banryu (literally, many flows of sakaya)

sen.j: やがて酒屋は、酒屋万流（さかやばんりゅう）といわれるように、総合商社的な特徴を生かして日本国中に強力な民間ネットワークを築いていた。
sen.e: As there is the term of sakaya banryu, sakaya became before long to establish a strong private network by effectively using its general trading house-like features.
As there is the term of sakaya banryu, sakaya established before long a strong private network by effectively using its general trading house-like features.
As there is the term of sakaya banryu, sakaya established before long a strong private network by effectively using its general trading house-like features.

sen.j: 酒そのものは、主に摂泉十二郷出身の酒屋が自前の蔵で醸造し、下り酒として江戸へ船で輸送し、江戸で売りさばいた。
sen.e: Sake itself was manufactured by sakaya mostly from Sessen-juni-go (the twelve districts in the Settsu province and Izumi province) in their own sake-factories, was transported to Edo as kudari-zake (sake transported from the Kyoto/Osaka area), and was sold in Edo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sake itself was manufactured by sakaya mostly from Sessen-juni-go (the twelve districts in the Settsu province and Izumi province) in their own sake-factories, was transported to Edo as kudari-zake (sake transported from the Kyoto/Osaka area), and was sold in Edo.

Sake itself was manufactured by sakaya mostly from Sessen-juni-go (the 12 districts in the Settsu Province and Izumi Province) in their own sake-factories, was transported to Edo as kudari-zake (sake transported from the Kyoto/Osaka area), and was sold in Edo.
sen.cmt: Province 大文字にしました。

sen.j: さらに、生産部門である蔵だけでなく、輸送・流通・販売・営業部門についても以下のように進出した。
sen.e: Furthermore, in addition to sake factories in the production sector, sakaya also advanced into the transportation, distribution, and sale sections as well, as described below:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, in addition to sake factories in the production sector, sakaya also advanced into the transportation, distribution, and sale sections as well, as described below:
Furthermore, in addition to sake factories in the production sector, sakaya also advanced into the transportation, distribution, and sale sections as well, as described below:

sen.j: まず輸送部門に関しては、はじめは廻船を差配する廻船問屋という稼業が酒屋とは別個に存在し営業していた。
sen.e: First, concerning the transportation sector, Kaisen donya (wholesaler in port), not sakaya, controlled cargo-vessels initially.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: First, concerning the transportation sector, Kaisen donya (wholesaler in port), not sakaya, controlled cargo-vessels initially.
First, concerning the transportation sector, Kaisen donya (wholesaler in port), not sakaya, controlled cargo-vessels initially.

sen.j: しかしながら、資本力をつけた酒屋が次々とこれを買収していった。
sen.e: However, having accumulated capital, sakaya took over kaisendonya one after another.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, having accumulated capital, sakaya took over kaisendonya one after another.
However, having accumulated capital, sakaya took over kaisen donya one after another.

sen.j: 酒屋自身が樽廻船問屋として自前の船を所有し、腕のよい船乗りたちを雇い入れ、今でいうフェリー・ターミナルにあたる廻船艀を大坂に出店するようになった。
sen.e: Then sakaya itself became to operate kaisenfu, which corresponds to a present ferry terminal, in Osaka, owning its own vessels as taru-kaisen-donya (a wholesaler handling cargo-vessels carrying sake barrels) and employing skilled sailors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then sakaya itself came to operate kaisenfu, which corresponds to the present ferry terminal in Osaka, owning its own vessels as taru-kaisen-donya (a wholesaler handling cargo-vessels carrying sake barrels) and employing skilled sailors.

Then sakaya itself came to operate kaisenfu, which corresponds to the present ferry terminal in Osaka, owning its own vessels as taru-kaisen-donya (a wholesaler handling cargo-vessels carrying sake barrels) and employing skilled sailors.

sen.j: また江戸には、下り酒を引き受ける江戸酒問屋下り酒の地廻り酒というものがあった。
sen.e: In Edo, there were kudai-zake-tonaya (wholesalers handling kudari-zake).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処下り酒を引き受ける江戸酒問屋下り酒の地廻り酒というものがあったが： ウェブでの”下り酒を引き受ける下り酒問屋というものがあったが”に置き換えて訳してあります。
sen.e: In Edo, there were kudai-zake-tonaya (wholesalers handling kudari-zake).
In Edo, there were kudari-zake-donya (wholesalers handling kudari-zake).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: だが、これもじつはそもそも上方の酒屋が自分のところの酒を江戸市民に売りこむため、手代など重要な人材を派遣し江戸に開店させた「営業所」であった。
sen.e: These tonya were originally sales offices that sakaya in kamigata (the Kyoto/Osaka area) opened in EDO to sell their own sake, and important personnel, such as clerks, were sent to these tonya
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These tonya were originally sales offices that sakaya in kamigata (the Kyoto/Osaka area) opened in EDO to sell their own sake, and important personnel, such as clerks, were sent to these tonya.
These tonya were originally sales offices that sakaya in kamigata (the Kyoto/Osaka area) opened in Edo to sell their own sake, and important personnel, such as clerks, were sent to these tonya.

sen.j: 摂泉十二郷のなかでも熾烈な販売競争があった。
sen.e: There was a furious selling competition even among sakaya in Sessen-juni-go.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There was a furious selling competition even among sakaya in Sessen-juni-go.
There was a furious selling competition even among sakaya in Sessen-juni-go.

sen.j: そのため、さらにこうした「営業所」は、自分の蔵の酒を良さをお客に熱心に説いて回る、いわば営業活動もまめに行なった。
sen.e: Therefore, in these "sales offices," sales activities to explain the superiority of sake manufactured by their won sake-factories were conducted actively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, in these "sales offices," sales activities to explain the superiority of sake manufactured by their own sake-factories were conducted actively.
Therefore, in these 'sales offices,' sales activities to explain the superiority of sake manufactured by their own sake-factories were conducted actively.

sen.j: こういう点からしても、ライバルの関東の酒である地廻り酒を扱う店はとてもではないが太刀打ちできなかったのである。
sen.e: Considering these points, the stores handling zimarawa-zake, which were manufactured in the Kanto area and competed with kudari-zake, were no match for those handling kudari-zake.
Considering these points, the stores handling zimarawa-zake, which were manufactured in the Kanto area and competed with kudari-zake, were no match for those handling kudari-zake.
Considering these points, the stores handling jimarawi-zake, which were manufactured in the Kanto area and competed with kudari-zake, were no match for those handling kudari-zake.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 黒船から幕末にかけては、このような営業マンの持つ情報テリトリーと、押し寄せてきた欧米列強の商社マンとの人脈、廻船や早馬など強力な自家流通ルートを生かして、情報産業にも進出していった。
sen.e: In the era from the arrival of Kuro-fune (Japanese name for Perry's Fleet) to the end of bakufu system, sakaya also advanced into information business by effectively using the information territory of these sales persons, human relations with trading company employees from western powers, and their own distribution routes.

In the era from the arrival of Kuro-fune (Japanese name for Perry's Fleet) to the end of the bakufu system, sakaya also advanced into information business by effectively using the information territory of these sales persons, human relations with trading company employees from western powers, and their own distribution routes.

In the era from the arrival of Kuro-fune (Japanese name for Perry's Fleet) to the end of the bakufu system, sakaya also advanced into information business by effectively using the information territory of these sales persons, human relations with trading company employees from western powers, and their own distribution routes.

sen.j: 風雲急を告げるこの激動の時代に、長州藩・薩摩藩などの反幕府側も、北国諸藩・箱館政権など旧幕府側も、酒屋に頼った情報入手、物資輸送の例は数知れない。
sen.e: In this turbulent and critical era, the Ｃhoshu domain and Satsuma domain, belonging to the anti-bakufu group, and domains in the northern region and the Hakodate government, belonging to the old bakufu group, relied on sakaya for obtaining information and transporting cargoes on innumerably many occasions

In this turbulent and critical era, the Choshu domain and Satsuma domain, belonging to the anti-bakufu group, and domains in the northern region and the Hakodate government, belonging to the old bakufu group, relied on sakaya for obtaining information and transporting cargoes on innumerably many occasions.

In this turbulent and critical era, the Choshu domain and Satsuma domain, belonging to the anti-bakufu group, and domains in the northern region and the Hakodate government, belonging to the old bakufu group, relied on sakaya for obtaining information and transporting cargoes on innumerably many occasions.

sen.j: 江州蔵と小売店
sen.e: Goshugura (see below) and retail shops
Goshugura (see below) and retail shops
Goshugura (Omi-style sake factories) and retail shops
sen.cmt: 江州蔵 補足を追加しました。

sen.j: メジャーな酒屋と違って、マイナーではあるが独自の投資経営技術で関東から東北にかけて幅広く小さな酒蔵や造り酒屋をたくさん展開した、近江商人の江州蔵（ごうしゅうぐら）という酒屋の形態も忘れてはならない。
sen.e: The sakaya style called goshugura described in the following should be also remembered: Being minor unlike the sakaya that was major, Omi shonin (merchants in the Omi province) deployed many small-sized sake-factories and tsukuri-zakaya throughout Kanto to Tohoku areas using their own business management technology (this business style is called Goshugura (literally, Omi-style sake factories).

The sakaya style called goshugura described in the following should be also remembered: Being minor unlike the sakaya that was major, Omi shonin (merchants in the Omi province) deployed many small-sized sake-factories and tsukuri-zakaya throughout the Kanto to Tohoku areas using their own business management technology (this business style is called Goshugura (literally, Omi-style sake factories).

The sakaya style called Goshugura described in the following should be also remembered: Being minor unlike the sakaya that was major, Omi shonin (merchants in the Omi Province) deployed many small-sized sake-factories and tsukuri-zakaya throughout the Kanto to Tohoku regions using their own business management technology.
sen.cmt: Province 大文字にしました。

sen.j: これらは細く長く明治以降もそのまま引き継がれ、けっして大規模ではないが確固としたシステムを基盤として今日の地方蔵にも残っているのである。
sen.e: This style has been handed down for a long period of time even after the Meiji period, although the business has not grown much, and still remains in local sake-factories, with the not-large-scaled but established system as its basis.

This style has been handed down for a long period of time even after the Meiji period, although the business has not grown much, and still remains in local sake-factories, with the not-large-scaled but established system as its basis.

This style has been handed down for a long period of time even after the Meiji period, although the business has not grown much, and still remains in local sake-factories, with the not-large-scaled but established system as its basis.

sen.j: また、町中の小売業としての酒屋については、江戸においては升酒屋（ますざかや）といった。
sen.e: A sakaya as a retail shop in towns was called masu-zakaya (masu: indicates a wooden box for measuring an amount of sake) in Edo．
sen.cmt: 江戸においては江戸酒問屋上方と江戸（ますざかや）といった： ウェブの”江戸においては升酒屋（ますざかや）といった”に置き換えて訳してあります。
sen.e: A sakaya as a retail shop in towns was called masu-zakaya (masu: indicates a wooden box for measuring an amount of sake) in Edo.
A sakaya as a retail shop in towns was called masu-zakaya (masu: indicates a wooden box for measuring an amount of sake) in Edo.

sen.j: 上方では、小売店を板看板酒屋（いたかんばんさかや）といった。
sen.e: In the kamigata (Kyoto/Osaka) area, a retail sake shop was called itakanban-sakaya (a sakaya with a sign board).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処小売店を江戸酒問屋上方と江戸（いたかんばんさかや）といったが： ウェブの”小売店を板看板酒屋（いたかんばんさかや）といったが”に置き換えて訳してあります。
sen.e: In the kamigata (Kyoto/Osaka) area, a retail sake shop was called itakanban-sakaya (a sakaya with a sign board).
In the kamigata (Kyoto/Osaka) area, a retail sake shop was called itakanban-sakaya (a sakaya with a sign board).

sen.j: しかしながら、これもメジャーな大酒屋が自分のところの酒の販売窓口として各都市に持っていた「営業所」にすぎなかった。
sen.e: However, such a place was only a "sales office" that a major sakaya owned to sell its won sake.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, such a place was only a "sales office" that a major sakaya owned to sell its own sake.
However, such a place was only a 'sales office' that a major sakaya owned to sell its own sake.

sen.j: ともかく同じ小売店であっても、上方と江戸では流通機構が異なるので、その位置づけも異なることは注意されなくてはならない。
sen.e: Any way, attention must be paid to the fact that, even though the same term of "retail shop was used, the positioning of the shop in the kamigata area was different from that in Edo because the distribution system in Edo was not the same as that in the kamigata area.
sen.cmt: 江戸酒問屋上方と江戸が異なる： ウェブの”流通機構が異なる”に置き換えたとして訳してあります。
sen.e: Any way, attention must be paid to the fact that, even though the same term of "retail shop was used, the positioning of the shop in the kamigata area was different from that in Edo because the distribution system in Edo was not the same as that in the kamigata area.

In any way, attention must be paid to the fact that, even though the same term of "retail shop" was used, the positioning of the shop in the kamigata area was different from that in Edo because the distribution system in Edo was not the same as that in the kamigata area.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションマークを追加しました。

sen.j: 近代以降
sen.e: In modern times and later
In modern times and later
In modern times and later

sen.j: 樽からの量り売り
sen.e: Selling sake by measure from a barrel

sen.j: 明治末年に白鶴によって一升瓶が開発された。
sen.e: Sake bottles of 1.8 liters were developed by Hakutsuru (a sake manufacturer) in the last year of the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処日本酒の歴史昭和時代前期（地方によっては昭和20年代）まで： ウェブの”昭和初期（地方によっては昭和20年代）まで”に置き換えて訳してあります。
sen.e: Sake bottles of 1.8 liters were developed by Hakutsuru (a sake manufacturer) in the last year of the Meiji period.
Issho-bin (sake bottles of 1.8 liters) were developed by Hakutsuru (a sake manufacturer) in the last year of the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一升瓶 を追加しました。

sen.j: しかしながら、全国津々浦々に浸透するまでに年月がかかった。
sen.e: However, it took much time for such bottles to become used throughout the nation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it took much time for such bottles to become used throughout the nation.
However, it took much time for such bottles to become used throughout the nation.

sen.j: このため、昭和初期（地方によっては昭和20年代）まで酒は現在のように瓶で売られるのではなく、町の酒屋においてはまだ酒樽からの量り売りするのが主流であった。
sen.e: Therefore, until the early Showa era (or show 20s in some areas), sake was sold mostly by measure from a sake barrel, not in a bottle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, until the early Showa era (or Showa 20s in some areas), sake was sold mostly by measure from a sake barrel, not in a bottle.
Therefore, until the early Showa period (or during the period from 1945 to 1954 in local regions), sake was sold mostly by measure from a sake barrel, not in a bottle.
sen.cmt: 昭和20年代 の補足を変更しました。

sen.j: 酒屋の店頭には、いろいろな酒蔵から買いつけてきた酒が菰（こも）をかぶった樽に入れられて置かれており、客の好みに合わせて、酒屋の主人がそれらをブレンドして売っていた。
sen.e: At that time, in a sakaya, sake barrels wrapped in a rush matt, which the shop bought from various sake factories, were placed, and for selling sake, the shop owner blended sake from these barrels so as to meet each customer's taste

At that time, in a sakaya, sake barrels wrapped in a rush mat, which the shop bought from various sake factories, were placed, and for selling sake, the shop owner blended sake from these barrels so as to meet each customer's taste.

At that time, in a sakaya, sake barrels wrapped in a rush mat, which the shop bought from various sake factories, were placed, and for selling sake, the shop owner blended sake from these barrels so as to meet each customer's taste.

sen.j: 酒を造っている蔵や杜氏からすれば、自分たちの造った酒を勝手に他の蔵の製品と混ぜられるのは、必ずしも愉快でなかったかもしれない。
sen.e: Sake-factories and touji might not necessarily have been pleasant to hear that their sake was mixed with products from other sake-factories.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sake-factories and touji might not necessarily have been pleasant to hear that their sake was mixed with products from other sake-factories.
Sake-factories and toji might not necessarily have been pleasant to hear that their sake was mixed with products from other sake-factories.

sen.j: しかしながら、どのようなブレンドをするかは酒屋の主人の力量の一つですらあった。
sen.e: However, it was even one of sakaya owner's abilities how to blend various sake products.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it was even one of sakaya owner's abilities how to blend various sake products.
However, it was even one of sakaya owner's abilities how to blend various sake products.

sen.j: たいてい来るのは地元の旧知の客ばかりであり、酒屋の主人は客の好みを熟知していた。
sen.e: Most of the customers coming to a sakaya were intimate with the shop owner fおr a long time, and the owner was well-informed about their tastes.
Most of the customers coming to a sakaya were intimate with the shop owner for a long time, and the owner was well-informed about their tastes.
Most of the customers coming to a sakaya were intimate with the shop owner for a long time, and the owner was well-informed about their tastes.

sen.j: すなわち、昭和初期の酒屋は現在のバーテンダー的な技量も必要だったのである。
sen.e: In other words, the techniques required for present bartenders were necessary for sakaya in the early Showa period.
In other words, the techniques required for present bartenders were necessary for sakaya in the early Showa period.
In other words, the techniques required for present bartenders were necessary for sakaya in the early Showa period.

sen.j: 販売する容量はおおかた２合、５合、１升（10合）（参照：日本酒単位）の三種類で、地方によってはごく稀に１合でも売られたという。
sen.e: The units of sake to be sold were mostly two goes (180 milliliters/go), five goes or one sho (10 goes/sho) (refer to units of Japanese sake), but it is said that sake of one go was sold in rare local places.

The units of sake to be sold were mostly two goes (180 milliliters/go), five goes or one sho (10 goes/sho) (refer to units of Japanese sake), but it is said that sake of one go was sold in rare local places.

The units of sake to be sold were mostly two goes (180 milliliters/go), five goes or one sho (10 goes/sho) (refer to units of Japanese sake), but it is said that sake of one go was sold in rare local places.

sen.j: 客はその酒屋からリースされている徳利を持参して買いにいった。
sen.e: A customer of a sakaya went to the shop to buy sake with a sake bottle the shop leased the customer.
A customer of a sakaya went to the shop to buy sake with a sake bottle the shop leased the customer.
A customer of a sakaya went to the shop to buy sake with a sake bottle the shop leased the customer.

sen.j: 今で言う「マイバッグ」のような「マイ徳利」持参が必須であった。
sen.e: It was essential to bring "my sake bottle" like "may bag" in the present day.
It was essential to bring "my sake bottle" like "may bag" in the present day.
It was essential to bring 'my sake bottle' like 'my bag' in the present day.

sen.j: やがて日中戦争が勃発し、日本酒が品薄になると、酒屋のなかには水をまぜて酒をうすめて販売するところもあらわれた。
sen.e: Then the Sino-Japanese war broke out, and when Japanese sake became unavailable enough, some sakaya sold watered-down sake.
Then the Sino-Japanese war broke out, and when there was a shortage of Japanese sake supplies, some sakaya sold watered-down sake.
Then the Sino-Japanese war broke out, and when there was a shortage of Japanese sake supplies, some sakaya sold watered-down sake.

sen.j: 金魚を入れても死なないくらい薄い酒ということで金魚酒と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Such sake was called goldfish sake, because the sake was so thin that no goldfish died in such sake.
Such sake was called goldfish sake, because the sake was so thin that no goldfish died in such sake.
Such sake was called goldfish sake, because the sake was so thin that no goldfish died in such sake.

sen.j: （参照：金魚酒の横行）
sen.e: (Refer to the section of the rampant state of goldfish business.)
sen.cmt: 日本酒の歴史昭和時代前期： ウェブの”金魚酒の横行”に置き換えて訳してあります。
sen.e: (Refer to the section of the rampant state of goldfish business.)
(Refer to the section of the rampant state of goldfish sake business.)
sen.cmt: goldfish sake business としました。

sen.j: なかには水を混ぜていないのに、客から「金魚酒にしただろう」と難癖をつけられ、「していない」と身の潔白を示すために抗議の自殺をした酒屋までも出現した。
sen.e: Even the following incident occurred: A sakaya owner who was accused by a customer of "serving goldfish sake" killed himself for clarifying that the owner served no goldfish sake to the customer.
Even the following incident occurred: A sakaya owner who was accused by a customer of "serving goldfish sake" killed himself for clarifying that the owner served no goldfish sake to the customer.
Even the following incident occurred: A sakaya owner who was accused by a customer of 'serving goldfish sake' killed himself for clarifying that the owner served no goldfish sake to the customer.

sen.j: このような酒屋も明治時代以降は、大きく二つの流れに分けて考えなくてはならない。
sen.e: In the Meiji period and later, it should be considered that sakaya became to take either of two major different business styles.
In the Meiji period and later, it should be considered that sakaya came to take either of two major different business styles.
In the Meiji period and later, it should be considered that sakaya came to take either of two major different business styles.

sen.j: メジャー路線としての政商・財閥
sen.e: Seisho (merchants with political ties) or zaibatsu (company syndicates) as the major business style
Seisho (merchants with political ties) or zaibatsu (company syndicates) as the major business style
Seisho (merchants with political ties) or zaibatsu (company syndicates) as the major business style

sen.j: 江戸時代以前の大手メジャーは、政商として商圏を国際的に拡大し、多方面にわたる貿易に乗り出していった。
sen.e: The major sakaya having existed in the Edo period or before started expanding their business internationally as seisho, advancing into various trade fields.
The major sakaya having existed in the Edo period or before started expanding their business internationally as seisho, advancing into various trade fields.
The major sakaya having existed in the Edo period or before started expanding their business internationally as seisho, advancing into various trade fields.

sen.j: これらは昭和時代初期には財閥として君臨することになる。
sen.e: They became to reign the business world in Japan as zaibatsu.
They came to reign the business world in Japan as zaibatsu.
They came to reign the business world in Japan as zaibatsu.

sen.j: 財閥解体以降も、銀行・証券・商社などさまざまな会社に分割されつつも、バブル経済のころまでは絶大な経済力を持った。
sen.e: Although zaibatsu was dissolved and was divided into banks, securities companies, trading companies, etc, they retained overwhelming economic power until around the bubble economy era.
Although zaibatsu were dissolved and divided into banks, securities companies, trading companies, etc, they retained overwhelming economic power until around the bubble economy era.
Although zaibatsu were dissolved and divided into banks, securities companies, trading companies, etc, they retained overwhelming economic power until around the bubble economy era.

sen.j: バブル崩壊後、外国資本が急速に日本経済界を席捲するなかで、江戸時代以来の酒屋の暖簾（のれん）、すなわち今日でいう資本系列の垣根を越えて、合併による生き残りが模索されている最中といってよい。
sen.e: After the bubble busted, foreign capital has invaded rapidly into the Japanese economic world, and in this trend, they have now been groping the way of how to survive through M&A, beyond the goodwill of sakaya retained since the Edo period, or beyond the barrier of the capital-based relationships.

After the bubble busted, foreign capital invaded rapidly into the Japanese economic world, and in this trend, they have now been groping for how to survive through M&A, beyond the goodwill of sakaya retained since the Edo period, or beyond the barrier of the capital-based relationships.

After the bubble busted, foreign capital invaded rapidly into the Japanese economic world, and in this trend, they have now been groping for how to survive through M&A, beyond the goodwill of sakaya retained since the Edo period, or beyond the barrier of the capital-based relationships.
(As of January, 2006)
(As of January, 2006)
(As of January, 2006)

sen.j: マイナー路線としての小売販売店
sen.e: Retail shops as a minor business style
Retail shops as a minor business style
Retail shops as a minor business style

sen.j: 明治時代から1980年代まで
sen.e: In the era from the Meiji period to 1980s
In the era from the Meiji period to the 1980s
In the era from the Meiji period to the 1980s

sen.j: 明治時代以降は、町中で諸方面の商品を扱うよろずや的な要素を高めていき、人々の生活と切っても切り離せない存在となった。
sen.e: In the Meiji period and later, these sake retail shops became to be provided with general store-like factors, becoming a place inseparable from lives of the general public.
In the Meiji period and later, these sake retail shops came to be provided with general store-like factors, becoming a place inseparable from lives of the general public.
In the Meiji period and later, these sake retail shops came to be provided with general store-like factors, becoming a place inseparable from lives of the general public.

sen.j: 酒屋の若い店員が各家庭に御用聞きといって、その日に必要な食料や日用品を注文を聞いて回り、あとから宅配するというサービスも一般的に行なわれていた。
sen.e: The so-called goyokiki service was provided generally in which a young shop attendant at a sakaya circulated its customers' houses, receiving orders of food and daily necessities for the day, and delivered them to the customers' houses later.

The so-called goyokiki service was provided generally in which a young shop attendant at a sakaya circulated its customers' houses, receiving orders of food and daily necessities for the day, and delivered them to the customers' houses later.

The so-called goyokiki service was provided generally in which a young shop attendant at a sakaya circulated its customers' houses, receiving orders of food and daily necessities for the day, and delivered them to the customers' houses later.

sen.j: そのような意味では、今日のスーパーマーケット、コンビニエンスストア、デリバリー・ショップを合わせたような存在であったともいえる。
sen.e: In that sense, it can also be said that such sakaya was a place provided with the natures of supermarkets, of convenience stores and of delivery shops.
In that sense, it can also be said that such sakaya were places that provided the services of supermarkets, convenience stores, and of delivery shops.
In that sense, it can also be said that such sakaya were places that provided the services of supermarkets, convenience stores, and of delivery shops.

sen.j: 1980年代から1990年代にかけて
sen.e: In the era from 1980s to 1990s
In the era from the 1980s to the 1990s
In the era from the 1980s to the 1990s

sen.j: 昭和時代後期以降には、大資本がそれぞれの町にある酒屋をフランチャイズ化し、多くの酒屋がコンビニやスーパーへ変化していき、また酒類の販売に関しては大型量販店がシェアを大きく奪うようになり、また酒類販売の規制緩和により酒の小売がしやすくなったこともあり、昔ながらの酒屋には逆風が吹き荒れた。
sen.e: In the latter half of the Showa period and later, conditions unfavorable for traditional retail sakaya shops prevailed in the following ways: Companies with lots of capital started taking retail sake shops in towns into their franchise systems, converting many retail sakaya shops to convenience stores or supermarkets, and concering the sale of liquor, large-scale mass sales stores became to take a big sales share and it became easier to sell sake due to the deregulation of liquor

In the latter half of the Showa period and later, conditions unfavorable for traditional retail sakaya shops prevailed in the following ways: Companies with lots of capital started taking retail sake shops in towns into their franchise systems, converting many retail sakaya shops to convenience stores or supermarkets, and cornering the sale of liquor, large-scale mass sales stores took a big sales share and it became easier to sell sake due to the deregulation of liquor.

In the latter half of the Showa period and later, conditions unfavorable for traditional retail sakaya shops prevailed in the following ways: Companies with lots of capital started taking retail sake shops in towns into their franchise systems, converting many retail sakaya shops to convenience stores or supermarkets; also regarding the sale of liquor, large-scale mass sales stores took a big sales share and it became easier to sell sake due to the deregulation of liquor.

sen.j: 1990年代以降
sen.e: In 1990s and later
In the 1990s and later
In the 1990s and later

sen.j: バブル崩壊後、平成時代に入ってからは、小売酒販店として酒屋本来の領分である「酒の専門店」として生き残りを図り、販売する品目を限定するかわりに、商品に関する情報を蓄えることで付加価値をつけ、健全な成長を続けている酒屋が各地に存在する。
sen.e: Entering the Heisei period (1989 -) after the bubble economy busted, many retail sake shops still exist in various areas that have continued healthy growth through the following efforts: Trying to survive as "a shop specialized in liquor" that is the essential function of sakaya as a retail sake shop, and limiting the products to be sold but adding values to the products through accumulating information about the products.

Entering the Heisei period (1989 -) after the bubble economy busted, many retail sake shops still exist in various areas that have continued healthy growth through the following efforts: Trying to survive as "a shop specialized in liquor" that is the essential function of sakaya as a retail sake shop, and limiting the products to be sold but adding values to the products through accumulating information about the products.

Entering the Heisei period (1989 and later) after the bubble economy busted, many retail sake shops still exist in various areas that have continued healthy growth through the following efforts: Trying to survive as 'a shop specialized in liquor' that is the essential function of sakaya as a retail sake shop, and limiting the products to be sold but adding values to the products through accumulating information about the products.

sen.j: 酒類販売の規制緩和により酒類小売業者の経営の改善等に関する緊急措置法が廃止された。
sen.e: Due to deregulation about liquor, the emergency measure law concerning the business management of retail liquor shop owners and its improvement was abolished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Due to the deregulation of liquor, the emergency measure law concerning the business management of retail liquor shop owners and its improvement was abolished.
Due to the deregulation of liquor, the emergency measure law concerning the business management of retail liquor shop owners and its improvement was abolished.

sen.j: そのため、続々と酒類を取り扱うコンビニやスーパーが、以前の新規酒類販売規制地域にも、続々と参入することが大いに予想される。
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered highly likely that many convenience stores and supermarkets selling liquor will advance into the places where it was regulated for liquor sellers to open new shops.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered highly likely that many convenience stores and supermarkets selling liquor will advance into the places where it was regulated for liquor sellers to open new shops.
Therefore, it is considered highly likely that many convenience stores and supermarkets selling liquor will advance into the places where it was regulated for liquor sellers to open new shops.

sen.j: 以前にもまして付加価値をつけ、競争に立ち向かって行く酒屋以外の生き残りは厳しいことになりそうである。
sen.e: It is likely that, for retail sake shops to survive in these situations, there would be no other means than confronting the competition through further providing additional values to their products to be sold.

It is likely that, for retail sake shops to survive in these situations, there would be no other means than confronting the competition through further providing additional values to their products to be sold.

It is likely that, for retail sake shops to survive in these situations, there would be no other means than confronting the competition through further providing additional values to their products to be sold.
